abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/GR_R_39X_V6B runtime.

GR_R_39X_V6B is to be used with the heavy-ion collision data from 2010.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

title: Condition data for 2010 CMS heavy-ion collision data

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/GR_R_44_V15 runtime.

GR_R_44_V15 is to be used with the heavy-ion collision data and proton-proton reference data from 2011.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

title: Condition data for 2011 CMS heavy-ion collision data and proton-proton reference data
